About.Access: Permission of General Manager is required to access those records not on Open Access. Records available on microfilm (Council Minutes 1887-1975; & Rates & Valuation List Books (1887 - 1962) are on open access and are available for public access through Hurstville City Council's Library & Information Service, corner of Queens Road and Dora Street Hurstville.

About.Acquisition focus: Hurstville City Council is an in-house archives. Our primary purpose is to capture, retain and preserve all items of archival value which record the Council's corporate memory.

About.Major holdings: Hurstville City Council: Minutes of Council; Rate and Valuations Books; Building Application, Development Application & Subdivision Registers; various administration record series.

About.References: Sargeant, Bernard The History of Hurstville Council Elections 1887 - 1995. Hurstville City Council, Hurstville 1997

Contact.Street address: Hurstville City Council, Civic Centre, MacMahon Street, Hurstville, 2220

This research centre is now closed and the services dispersed: the Local Studies collection is available in the Central Library and the Archives are now a separate section, within the Administration Directorate.
